definition: he or him/(used for either sex when the sex is unknown or unimportant)/(used before sb's name for emphasis)/(used as a meaningless mock object)/other/another
to kill/to murder/to attack/to weaken or reduce/to smart (dialect)/(used after a verb) extremely

sentences.english: He mutilated the nun and stuffed into a closet.
sentences.chinese: 他殺了一名修女，他碎屍然後把屍體賽進櫃子。

sentences.english: Every time before he killed a cow, he cut out its tongue and ate it with liquor.
sentences.chinese: 每次他殺牛之前，他都會把牛的舌頭割下來下酒。

sentences.english: Bathsheba He had Uriah killed so he could sleep with her.
sentences.chinese: 他殺了烏利亞然後佔有了。

sentences.english: I've told you this over and over again, he kills Muggles for fun.
sentences.chinese: 我已經告訴你一遍又一遍了，他殺麻瓜是爲了樂趣。

sentences.english: The mayor at the time said there was no conclusive evidence he killed himself.
sentences.chinese: 當時的市長說，沒有結論性的證據說明他殺了自己。

sentences.english: Now she believes Cleopatra was murdered.
sentences.chinese: 現在她認爲克利奧帕特拉是他殺。

sentences.english: Why XianLe said he killed her?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼仙樂說他殺了她？

sentences.english: Lee is on the spot because he killed a little girl.
sentences.chinese: 李已被判死刑，因爲他殺了一個小女孩。

sentences.english: A： They say she killed her first husband.
sentences.chinese: 聽人說他殺了她的第一任丈夫。

sentences.english: He killed the guard and made away.
sentences.chinese: 他殺逝世了衛兵後匆倉促逃走了。

sentences.english: The suicide note precluded the possibility of murder.
sentences.chinese: 那封絕命書排除了他殺的可能性。

sentences.english: We wantrevenge on the family of Saul, for he murdered our fathers, mothers, brothers, sisters, and so on.
sentences.chinese: 我們要對所羅王報仇，他殺了我們的父母兄弟。

sentences.english: Jacob told me he killed you.
sentences.chinese: 雅各佈告訴我他殺了你。

sentences.english: Gratiano. He's gone, but his wife's kill'd.
sentences.chinese: 葛萊西安諾他走了，他的妻子給他殺了。

definition: dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
to execute by firing squad/to shoot dead/fig. to discard/to get rid of
to conspire to murder/to plot against sb's life
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
unfettered and beyond the law (idiom); evading retribution/getting away with it (e.g. crimes)/still at large
